name: NewYorker
text: “Although many are becoming comfortable spurting out phrases like ‘systemic racism,’ the solutions proposed remain mired in the system that is being critiqued,” @KeeangaYamahtta writes. https://t.co/aZUXExYRx1

name: NewYorker
text: The coronavirus pandemic, as has often been noted, oﬀers an opportunity to reopen with a greater recognition of inequalities. For the school system, there is a risk that the reopening process will only amplify those divisions. https://t.co/msX4hYz9v7

name: NewYorker
text: “With video, I ﬁnd I need to sit still and look, and the drama of faces is much more intense,” a psychoanalyst conducting remote sessions said. “I can see the tears; I can hear the cracks in the voices.” https://t.co/vbPmaZUZEp
